name: Runes of Inconsequence
entries: You inscribe a rune onto a piece of paper, document, or surface. The rune hums with unstable magical nonsense, waiting for the next creature to read or open the marked object. When triggered, the rune unleashes a harmless but dramatic effect that startles, annoys, or mildly entertains.
The effect is randomly determined by rolling a {@dice d6}:
The rune fades after being triggered. A creature that succeeds a DC 13 Arcana check while inspecting the document can spot the rune before triggering it.
1  | A burst of confetti and a trumpet fanfare plays.
2  | The reader hears a magical raspberry blown directly into their ear.
4  | The paper insults the reader in a refined accent.
6  | A small illusory bird flaps out and poops ghost ink on them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: You can place one additional rune per spellcasting modifier (minimum of 1), but only one rune may be triggered at a time, and all runes share the same effect for the day.
